sen.j: 剣璽（けんじ）は三種の神器のうち、天叢雲剣と八尺瓊勾玉を併せた呼称。
sen.e: Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds") and Yasakani no magatama (comma-shaped jewel), which are two of the Sanshu no Jingi (Three Imperial Regalia), are combined and referred to as Kenji (sacred/divine sword and jewel).

Kenji is the term used when combining the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds") and the Yasakani no magatama (comma-shaped jewel), two of the Sanshu no Jingi (Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family).
sen.cmt: moved "Kenji" to the beginning of the sentence; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Kenji is the term used when combining the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (literally "Heavenly Sword of Assembled Clouds") and the Yasakani no magatama (comma-shaped jewel), two of the Sanshu no Jingi (Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family).

sen.j: 神器の勾玉を璽（あるいは神璽）とも呼ぶため、「剣璽」と称される。
sen.e: The jewel of the Imperial Regalia is referred to as ji of 'Kenji', (or Sinji, divine jewel)
The jewel of the Imperial Treasures is referred to as the 'ji' of 'Kenji' (or 'Shinji' meaning 'divine jewel').
The jewel of the Imperial Treasures is referred to as the 'ji' of 'Kenji' (or 'Shinji' meaning 'divine jewel').

sen.j: 現在は、皇居の天皇の寝室の隣に「剣璽の間」があり、そこに神剣（天叢雲剣のレプリカとされる）と神璽（本物の八尺瓊勾玉とされる）が安置されている。
sen.e: Today, the divine sword (considered as a replica of Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi) and the divine jewel (considered as a genuine Yasakani no magatama) are placed in 'the Kenji room' next to the Emperor's bedroom in the Imperial Palace.

Today, the divine sword (considered to be a replica of the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi) and the divine jewel (considered to be the genuine Yasakani no magatama) are placed in the 'Kenji room' next to the Emperor's bedroom in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: changed "considered as" to "considered to be"; moved quote mark from 'the Kenji room' to 'Kenji room'
sen.e: Today, the divine sword (considered to be a replica of the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi) and the divine jewel (considered to be the genuine Yasakani no magatama) are placed in the 'Kenji room' next to the Emperor's bedroom in the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 神鏡（八咫鏡のレプリカ）は宮中三殿の神体として安置されている。
sen.e: The divine mirror (a replica of Yata no Kagami) is placed as a shintai (object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court

The divine mirror (a replica of the Yata no Kagami) is enshrined as a shintai (an object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: changed "placed" to "enshrined" for "安置"; added "the" before "Yata"; added "an" before "object";
sen.e: The divine mirror (a replica of the Yata no Kagami) is enshrined as a shintai (an object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 戦前は天皇が一泊以上の旅行のため皇居（宮城）を離れる時に、侍従が神剣と勾玉を捧げ持ち随行した。
sen.e: Before the WW2, when the Emperor was away from the Imperial Palace to travel for two or more days, a chamberlain who accompanied the Emperor carried the divine sword and jewel.
Before World War II, a chamberlain accompanying the Emperor would carry the divine sword and jewel when the Emperor left the Imperial Palace to travel for two or more days.
sen.cmt: changed "Before the WW2" to "Before World War II"; rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: Before World War II, a chamberlain accompanying the Emperor would carry the divine sword and jewel when the Emperor left the Imperial Palace to travel for two or more days.

sen.j: これを剣璽動座という。
sen.e: This is referred to as Kenji-doza
This is referred to as Kenji-doza
This is referred to as Kenji-doza.

sen.j: 戦後にも何度か行われたが、動座することは少なくなった。
sen.e: After the WW2, Kenji-doza is still performed but gets infrequent.
Although Kenji-doza has been performed a number of times since the end of World War II as well, it occurs infrequently.
sen.cmt: changed "WW2" to "World War II"; fixed grammar to read more naturally

sen.j: 即位後天皇自らが伊勢神宮に参拝する際に、剣璽と共に参拝している。
sen.e: The Emperor visited Ise-jingu shrine with the divine sword and jewel after his enthronement.
The Emperor visited Ise Jingu Shrine with the divine sword and jewel after his enthronement.

tit.j: 剣璽渡御の儀（剣璽等承継の儀）
tit.e: Kenji Togyo no Gi, or the ceremony to transfer the Kenji (the succession ceremony of the Kenji and others)
Kenji Togyo no Gi (the succession ceremony of the Kenji)
tit.cmt: eliminated "or the ceremony to transfer the Kenji" since it seemed unecessary;
tit.e: Kenji Togyo no Gi (the succession ceremony of the Kenji)

sen.j: 剣璽渡御の儀は、天皇が譲位・崩御し皇位継承者（皇嗣）が践祚（即位の礼）する時に行われる。
sen.e: Kenji Togyo no Gi is performed when the Emperor abdicates his throne or passes away, and the imperial heir accedes the throne.
sen.cmt: 文を分けたため、文末に「行われる」performed, を補いました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kenji Togyo no Gi is performed when the Emperor abdicates the throne or passes away and the imperial heir accedes the throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kenji Togyo no Gi is performed when the Emperor abdicates the throne or passes away and the imperial heir accedes the throne.

sen.j: それは、皇位の証として剣と璽を新天皇に受け継ぐ儀式である。
sen.e: It is a succession ceremony to transfer the divine sword and jewel to the new Emperor, as symbol of the imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a succession ceremony to transfer the divine sword and jewel to the new Emperor as symbol of the imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; eliminated comma
sen.e: It is a succession ceremony to transfer the divine sword and jewel to the new Emperor as symbol of the imperial throne.

sen.j: 神体である剣と璽が新帝の下に自ら動くという建前から「渡御」（神・天皇等が「渡る」ことをいう尊敬語）という表現がとられる。
sen.e: Since it is considered that the sacred objects, the sword and jewel move to the new Emperor by themselves, the expression 'togyo' (an honorific term of 'transfer' for gods or the Emperors) is used.

Since the sword and the jewel are considered sacred objects, they are considered to move to the new Emperor on their own, so the expression used is 'togyo' (an honorific term for 'transfer' of gods or Emperors).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Since the sword and the jewel are considered sacred objects, they are considered to move to the new Emperor on their own, so the expression used is 'togyo' (an honorific term for 'transfer' of gods or Emperors).

sen.j: 戦後廃止された登極令（明治42年（1909年）皇室令第1号）によれば、侍従が「奉仕」して「渡御」する剣と璽及び、内大臣秘書官が捧持する国璽と御璽を内大臣が天皇の前にある机の上に置くことが行われる。
sen.e: According to the Imperial Accession Law (in 1909, Imperial Household law No.1), which was abolished after the WW2, in the ceremony, the divine sword and jewel 'served' and 'transferred' by a chamberlain, and the Great seal and the Imperial seal held by a secretary of the Minister of the Palace were placed on the table in front of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 登極令 'imperial accession law'は仮訳です。
sen.e: According to the Imperial Accession Law (1909 Imperial Household law No.1), which was abolished after World War II, the divine sword and jewel were to be 'served' and 'transferred' by a chamberlain in the ceremony, while the Great seal and Imperial seal were to be held by a secretary of the Minister of the Palace and placed on a table in front of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: eliminated "in" before "1909"; changed "the WW2" to "World War II"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: According to the Imperial Accession Law (1909 Imperial Household law No.1), which was abolished after World War II, the divine sword and jewel were to be 'served' and 'transferred' by a chamberlain in the ceremony, while the Great seal and Imperial seal were to be held by a secretary of the Minister of the Palace and placed on a table in front of the Emperor.

sen.j: なお、三種の神器の内、神鏡は宮中三殿の賢所の神体であるためこの儀式では動かない。
sen.e: However, in this ceremony, the divine mirror is not transferred because the mirror is a sacred object of the Kashikodokoro (the Sanctuary) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.
In this ceremony, however, the divine mirror is not transferred since it is a sacred object of the Kashikodokoro (the Sanctuary) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.

sen.e: In this ceremony, however, the divine mirror is not transferred since it is a sacred object of the Kashikodokoro (the Sanctuary) of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 剣璽渡御の儀と同時刻に「賢所の儀」が行われ、賢所で神に対し践祚の旨が告げられる。
sen.e: In the Kashikodokoro, 'Kashikodokoro no Gi' (the Ceremony in the Sanctuary in the Imperial Palace) is performed at the same time with the Kenji Togyo no Gi to tell gods the completion of the enthronement.
At the Kashikodokoro, 'Kashikodokoro no Gi' (Ceremony in the Sanctuary in the Imperial Palace) is performed at the same time as 'Kenji Togyo no Gi' to inform the gods of the completed enthronement.

sen.e: At the Kashikodokoro, 'Kashikodokoro no Gi' (Ceremony in the Sanctuary in the Imperial Palace) is performed at the same time as 'Kenji Togyo no Gi' to inform the gods of the completed enthronement.

sen.j: 明仁皇位継承の際の1989年1月7日には、憲法の政教分離規定への配慮から「剣璽等承継の儀」とされた。
sen.e: January 7, 1989, when Akihito succeeded his throne, the ceremony was referred to as 'the succession ceremony of the Kenji and others' according to the principle of separation of religions and state.

sen.j: 剣・璽の他、国璽・御璽を侍従が新天皇の前にある机に置く短い儀式が、皇位継承後まもなく宮殿の正殿松の間で行われた。
sen.e: Soon after the succession to the Imperial Throne, a brief ceremony was performed in the Main Hall of Matsu (Pine) of the Imperial Palace that the chamberlain placed the sword, the jewel, and the Great seal and the Imperial seal on the table in front of the new Emperor.
